$interpreted: : Six days later
Cecil: Your Majesty, as one of your most loyal subordinates,
Cecil: my family has been following and serving the descendants of the Dragonslayer for years. We've protected this land with the utmost...
Theodore: Skip the flattering. Why are you here?
Cecil: ... The precious blood of my father has been undeservingly spilled across the floor of a disgusting, loathsome prison cell.
Cecil: Today, I shall redeem my father from such humiliation. The glory and honor of the Vincent family will not rot in the filthy waters of prison.
Theodore: Come forth with your accusation. Who is responsible for disgracing your father's honor?
Cecil: Commander of the Royal Infantry, Dylan Levon. He must bear the responsibility for this case.
Dylan: I swear by my name and reputation, I will bear responsibility for this case.
Cecil: Dylan Levon. Without clear evidence, you arrested my father and imprisoned him. On top of all that, you neglected to take proper care of him,
Cecil: leading to his undeserved death during his confinement. What do you have to say?
Dylan: In regards to the case of Douglas Vincent's death during imprisonment, I'm still investigating it. However, we have obtained evidence
Dylan: sufficient enough to arrest and begin trial.
Cecil: What kind of evidence?
Dylan: In a very suspicious underground criminal gang, we discovered the token of loyalty for your family.
Dylan: Your father also has knowledge about a secret code between the assassin and the gang. That has given us enough reasons to arrest him.
Cecil: Outrageous! The token of loyalty has always been preserved in our family manor. There's no way you can find it in a filthy place like a criminal gang.
Cecil: More importantly, the token of loyalty is in my possession, right here, right now.
Dylan: How's that possible?
Theodore: Bring it to me.
Theodore: Dylan Levon, only an authentic token of loyalty can resonate with the blood of the Royal family.
Theodore: Cecil Vincent's token of loyalty is indeed, real.
Cecil: This should be enough evidence to prove my father's innocence.
Dylan: It can't be!? When I visited the Vincent family, he couldn't provide me the token of loyalty to investigate back then...
Theodore: Dylan Levon, you must now pay for your mistake!
Dylan: NO!
Theodore: Apprehend him!
Theodore: Dylan Levon, you've tainted the honor of the Royal Infantry.
Theodore: Even though you've accomplished countless deeds in the past, that is not enough to compensate what you have done.
Theodore: I'm very disappointed. As a descendant of the Dragonslayer, I will not be merciful...
Dylan: If I was to die like a worthless criminal in prison, I would rather die on the battlefield like a warrior,
Dylan: alongside my fellow soldiers, who protected this kingdom with me!
Theodore: Silence!
Theodore: ... During this investigation, Dylan Levon has tainted the honor of the Royal Infantry and his dignity as its commander
Theodore: and cost irreparable damage to the Vincent family. However, in gratitude for his deeds and

Theodore: contributions to the Kingdom during "The Desert Wars", He will be spared from execution. 
I hereby announce that Dylan Levon will be
Theodore: stripped of his position as commander of the Royal Infantry. He will transfer to the borders as Colonel of Sunshine Infantry, effective immediately.
Dylan: My gratitude, regent Theodore. However, for the Princess's coming-of-age ceremony, please allow me to return to the Capitol and participate.
Dylan: After all, that's a moment worthy of commemoration.
Theodore: .......
Jahan: Your Majesty, that was the golden opportunity. Why didn't you just execute him? Weren't you planning to make him disappear in the first place?
Jahan: It damn near cost Jahan's life trying to frame him.
Theodore: You just showed me your worth; don't waste it now.

Theodore: If Dylan dies in the Capitol, 
those foolish peasants who like to worship heroes will only cause more trouble...
Jahan: But your Majesty...
Theodore: ... A hero shall die on the battlefield, where he belongs.

Model.Text: Six days later
Your Majesty, as one of your most loyal subordinates,
my family has been following and serving the descendants of the Dragonslayer for years. We've protected this land with the utmost...
Skip the flattering. Why are you here?
... The precious blood of my father has been undeservingly spilled across the floor of a disgusting, loathsome prison cell.
Today, I shall redeem my father from such humiliation. The glory and honor of the Vincent family will not rot in the filthy waters of prison.
Come forth with your accusation. Who is responsible for disgracing your father's honor?
Commander of the Royal Infantry, Dylan Levon. He must bear the responsibility for this case.
I swear by my name and reputation, I will bear responsibility for this case.
Dylan Levon. Without clear evidence, you arrested my father and imprisoned him. On top of all that, you neglected to take proper care of him,
leading to his undeserved death during his confinement. What do you have to say?
In regards to the case of Douglas Vincent's death during imprisonment, I'm still investigating it. However, we have obtained evidence
sufficient enough to arrest and begin trial.
What kind of evidence?
In a very suspicious underground criminal gang, we discovered the token of loyalty for your family.
Your father also has knowledge about a secret code between the assassin and the gang. That has given us enough reasons to arrest him.
Outrageous! The token of loyalty has always been preserved in our family manor. There's no way you can find it in a filthy place like a criminal gang.
More importantly, the token of loyalty is in my possession, right here, right now.
How's that possible?
Bring it to me.
Dylan Levon, only an authentic token of loyalty can resonate with the blood of the Royal family.
Cecil Vincent's token of loyalty is indeed, real.
This should be enough evidence to prove my father's innocence.
It can't be!? When I visited the Vincent family, he couldn't provide me the token of loyalty to investigate back then...
Dylan Levon, you must now pay for your mistake!
NO!
Apprehend him!
Dylan Levon, you've tainted the honor of the Royal Infantry.
Even though you've accomplished countless deeds in the past, that is not enough to compensate what you have done.
I'm very disappointed. As a descendant of the Dragonslayer, I will not be merciful...
If I was to die like a worthless criminal in prison, I would rather die on the battlefield like a warrior,
alongside my fellow soldiers, who protected this kingdom with me!
Silence!
... During this investigation, Dylan Levon has tainted the honor of the Royal Infantry and his dignity as its commander
and cost irreparable damage to the Vincent family. However, in gratitude for his deeds and

contributions to the Kingdom during "The Desert Wars", He will be spared from execution. 
I hereby announce that Dylan Levon will be
stripped of his position as commander of the Royal Infantry. He will transfer to the borders as Colonel of Sunshine Infantry, effective immediately.
My gratitude, regent Theodore. However, for the Princess's coming-of-age ceremony, please allow me to return to the Capitol and participate.
After all, that's a moment worthy of commemoration.
Your Majesty, that was the golden opportunity. Why didn't you just execute him? Weren't you planning to make him disappear in the first place?
It damn near cost Jahan's life trying to frame him.
You just showed me your worth; don't waste it now.

If Dylan dies in the Capitol, 
those foolish peasants who like to worship heroes will only cause more trouble...
But your Majesty...
... A hero shall die on the battlefield, where he belongs.
